qas.question: When did draining of Lake Texcoco begin?
How much water is there, approximately, in the lake Mexico City is on?
How much has the city fallen?

answers.text: as much as nine metres (30 feet)

qas.question: What does Mexico City rest on?
Where are most of the trees located in Mexico City?

context: Mexico city primarily rests on what was <a3_0>Lake Texcoco<a3_0/>. Seismic activity is frequent here. Lake Texcoco was drained starting from the <a0_0>17th century<a0_0/>. Although <a1_0>none<a1_0/> of the lake waters remain, the city rests on the lake bed's heavily saturated clay. This soft base is collapsing due to the over-extraction of groundwater, called groundwater-related subsidence. Since the beginning of the 20th century the city has sunk <a2_0>as much as nine metres (30 feet)<a2_0/> in some areas. This sinking is causing problems with runoff and wastewater management, leading to flooding problems, especially during the rainy season. The entire lake bed is now paved over and most of the city's remaining forested areas lie in the <a4_0>southern boroughs<a4_0/> of Milpa Alta, Tlalpan and Xochimilco.
